## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been hearing a lot about DeFi and its potential issues. Can you tell me about the Verus DeFi protocol and how it addresses some of those issues while providing incentives to miners and stakers? Additionally, what are some of the features of launching a new blockchain and liquidity pool on the Verus network?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi protocol is a decentralized protocol that ensures simultaneous pricing and solving of all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block. This addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, which can lead to unfair advantages and losses for users. The protocol provides fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.

One of the key features of the Verus DeFi protocol is the ability to launch a new blockchain and liquidity pool simultaneously. This allows for the creation of a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. The bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies, but are bound to the launch of the new blockchain and run on the new blockchain. All fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, ensuring seamless connectivity.

Another feature of the Verus DeFi protocol is the ability to launch blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds. This allows users to set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in their preferred currencies on-chain. If the minimum levels are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of all their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, and more.
